div.ab: One holds certain that heating red-hot the mineral salt, which resembles marble & which one calls Cardona salt in Catalonia & at the border of Spain, thr & throwing it in the all red or quite hot into wine, that it turns it into very good vinegar. Some make it with water poured on pomace soured after being pressed by vintagers, but it does not keep, & spoils in heat & thunder storms.
